Delisting

There has been no official announcement of Beyond Good & Evil HD being delisted, but users and news sites immediately noticed then reported on this title as soon as it disappeared June 19th, 2024.

Ubisoft has pulled its beloved action-adventure Beyond Good and Evil from a number of digital stores, prompting speculation that its previously announced remaster is set to launch very soon.

Over on Steam, Beyond Good and Evil’s store page now reads, “At the request of the publisher, Beyond Good and Evil is unlisted on the Steam store and will not appear in search.”

Eurogamer news post – June 19, 2024

The title however has not yet been fully removed, as of the current posting date (July 29, 2024) the download is still available to buy on PC from the Ubisoft Store and on the PS3 PlayStation Network store – and if you have purchased the game previously on other platforms where it has been removed, it is still available to be re-downloaded from the account it was purchased on of course.

These delisting events were previously alluded to in November of last year (2023) when a new edition of BG&E appeared out of nowhere, leaking via a pre-development build of the game by accident on Xbox Live before it had even been announced to the public. I myself had even guessed that this would cause a delisting due to similar cases from Ubisoft in the past, it’s just a shame we can’t have forewarning or a premonition for dates before these games actually disappear.

Quoting that previous article here on the site – “Re-release projects like this are a common method for promotion to keep interest in the property/IP higher over time and serves of a reminder on how differing companies are at handling their legacy properties – as sometimes a publisher might even go as far as to remove older versions of a game from stores to force more interest in the newest version.”

About the Game

Statistics:

Genre – Science Fiction, Action-Adventure.

Gameplay Format – Third person perspective, Single player.

Game Modes – Story, No additional/alternate modes.

Game Mechanics – Stealth, Puzzle solving, Melee combat, Picture taking, Vehicle piloting, Companion character commands.

Hardware Compatibility – Backwards compatibility – No enhancements (Xbox One, Xbox Series.)

Languages Supported: Text – English, Deutsch, Español, Français, Italiano, Nederlands.

Voice – Exact same as text supported languages.

Install Size – 1.5 GB (GOG PC), 1.68 GB (Xbox), 1.5GB (PlayStation).

Launch Price – 800 Microsoft Points (Xbox), $10/£7.99 (GOG).

Age rating – ESRB T (Teen) – Comic Mischief, Violence.

PEGI 12 – Bad Language, Violence, Gambling.

Subscription service availability – (PlayStation Plus, Pre-2022 version) Free to add to account, 3 November – 1 December 2015.

PlayStation 3/Xbox 360:

PSN Store description:

“Beyond Good & Evil, the award-winning action-adventure game by Ubisoft, is back on PlayStation Network, now in High Definition graphics. Play as Jade, a young investigative reporter, and expose a terrible government conspiracy. Wary of her government’s promises to repel the aliens for good, she sets out to capture the truth behind the prolonged war. Armed with a camera, a dai-jo staff, and fierce determination, it’s your job to save your planet and its inhabitants.

– Live an epic and colorful adventure.

– Pioneering action-adventure

– The trophies, one more reason to revisit the game”

Xbox Store Description:

“Play as Jade, a young investigative reporter, and expose a terrible government conspiracy. It is up to you and your loyal pig friend Pey’j to save your planet and its inhabitants. “We’re deeply in love with BG&E” – 10/10 360 Gamer”

PC:

GOG Store description:

“For centuries, the planet Hillys has been bombarded by a relentless alien race. Sceptical of her government’s inability to repel the invaders, a rebellious action reporter named Jade sets out to capture the truth. Armed with her camera, dai-jo staff and fierce determination, she discovers shocking evidence leading to a horrific government conspiracy and is forced to battle an evil she cannot possibly fathom.

Join the Rebellion as action reporter Jade, join an underground resistance group and expose your government’s secrets using stealth, force and wits. Stop at nothing until your people know the truth. Expose the Conspiracy. Enter a futuristic world full of deception, where nothing is as it seems and exposing the truth is the only hope of restoring freedom.

Diverse gameplay elements, including stealth, vehicle combat, flying and shooting photos

Awesome and helpful sidekicks that will aid you with your hardest missions

Great visuals and a memorable, breathtaking soundtrack”
